cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of Mobile, Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting north, then turning north-northeast toward the Alabama/Florida Panhandle coast and inland across southeastern Alabama
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Alabama Gulf Coast in the vicinity of Mobile Bay/Gulf Shores

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for this portion of coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: east of Bay St. Louis, MS, to Navarre, FL. Storm Surge Warning: Mouth of the Mississippi River to the Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL, including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Mississippi across Alabama to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane conditions expected with sustained winds 74–85 mph and higher gusts beginning tonight through Wednesday at Mobile Bay
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 4–6 ft above ground possible in Mobile Bay and adjacent coastline
weather_observation.rainfall: Extreme rainfall of 10–20 inches with isolated totals up to 30 inches likely, producing historic flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Tornado risk in outer rainbands; life-threatening surf and rip currents; widespread river flooding potential after landfall
